body_html:
@gunan Make all the comments here.

Just for consistency, would you mind adding the default here too:
option(tensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS "Enables CPU SIMD instructions" OFF)

Sure

This is a highly specific script that will only work on your machine, with all the tools installed in the locations you installed them.
Please remove and expand README.md in this folder.

It meant to be a general script on windows, which auto searches requirements on the machine, helps developers to quickly build tensorflow with cmake specifically on Windows. I will delete the confused path string and expand the README.md about this script.

Is this meant to be a comment?
or is it mistakenly commented out?

I will delete this comment.

should we wrap this with "ifndef _Win32" instead?

Sure.

Any updates here gzmkl ?

I can wrap with a "ifdef _Win32"

I feel like all these typedefs need to be merged into one.

Definitely.

I will update ASAP.

body:
@gunan Make all the comments here.
>Just for consistency, would you mind adding the default here too:
option(tensorflow_WIN_CPU_SIMD_OPTIONS "Enables CPU SIMD instructions" OFF)

Sure

>This is a highly specific script that will only work on your machine, with all the tools installed in the locations you installed them.
Please remove and expand README.md in this folder.

It meant to be a general script on windows, which auto searches requirements on the machine, helps developers to quickly build tensorflow with cmake specifically on Windows.  I will delete the confused path string and expand the `README.md` about this script.

>Is this meant to be a comment?
or is it mistakenly commented out?

I will delete this comment.

>should we wrap this with "ifndef _Win32" instead?

Sure.

>Any updates here gzmkl ?

I can wrap with a "ifdef _Win32"

>I feel like all these typedefs need to be merged into one.

Definitely.

I will update ASAP.
